definitions.definition: To draw out ; to pull out ; to remove forcibly from a fixed position, as by traction or suction, etc.
examples: to extract a tooth from its socket, a stump from the earth, or a splinter from the finger

definitions.definition: To withdraw by squeezing , distillation , or other mechanical or chemical process. Compare abstract (transitive verb).
examples: to extract an essential oil from a plant

definitions.definition: To choose out; to cite or quote, for example a passage from a text.
To select parts of a whole
examples: We need to try to extract the positives from the defeat.

definitions.definition: To determine (a root of a number).
examples: Please extract the cube root of 27.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To draw out ; to pull out ; to remove forcibly from a fixed position, as by traction or suction, etc.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To withdraw by squeezing , distillation , or other mechanical or chemical process. Compare abstract (transitive verb).
( transitive ) To choose out; to cite or quote, for example a passage from a text.
( transitive ) To select parts of a whole
( transitive , arithmetic ) To determine (a root of a number).
